description: From Tamil சுண்ணம் (cuṇṇam, “lime, ground mortar”), from Sanskrit चूर्ण (cūrṇa, “powder; lime”).

entries.meaning: A type of plaster used in India, made from shell-lime and sand.
examples: The one Mr Cleveland and I inhabited was, as I have already observed, constructed of mud instead of chunam.

verbs.description: chunam (third-person singular simple present chunams, present participle chunaming or chunamming, simple past and past participle chunamed or chunammed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To plaster or waterproof with chunam.
examples: A PUNT FOR SALE, thirty-four feet long, twelve feet broad, and three feet ten inches deep, chunamed, sheathed, and coppered, carries about fifteen tons.
